page.title: 05OAST THEATRE TONBRIDGE
page.content: The Oast is the second site for the Tonbridge Theatre and Arts Club.The first site was a room rented from the Mitre Inn by the club.By the late 60's they had been going for 20 years and they needed a larger property of their own.The Oast was found in ruins in 1969 and was suggested as a possible new site.Many members saw its potent- ial,particularly 7,who offered Â£1000 each provided a further Â£1500,necess- ary for restoration,was found.The money was raised and the Oast was bought.Over 5 years the Oast was restored and began to take shape as a theatre.The members put many hours into the Oast and on 20th April 1974 it was opened by Lady Abergavenny who was standing in for the famous actress Edith Evans who was ill.Since then the theatre has grown in size and popular- ity and there are now 1200 members.
